isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Engine Oil Check

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To check engine oil level, quality, and pressure.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Check oil level with oil level gauge.

note.para: If the oil level is not at full, the fuel injectors will not work correctly. If the oil level is above full, the engine has been incorrectly serviced, or fuel is diluting the oil. Check for fuel odor in oil.

step1.para: Inspect oil for color and odor. Milky white oil and an ethylene glycol odor will indicate coolant contamination.

Check engine service records for correct oil grade and viscosity for ambient operating temperatures. Do not use 15W-40 oil below 20°F (-6.7°C). Long oil drain intervals can increase oil viscosity; thicker oil will make engine cranking and starting more difficult below freezing temperatures. See lube oil chart in the engine operator's manual for the correct grade of oil for vehicle operation in various temperature ranges.

item.para: Low oil level - Oil leak, oil consumption, or incorrect servicing.
High oil level - Incorrect servicing, fuel dilution from lift pump.
Oil contamination with coolant - Oil cooler, head gasket porosity, (accessories i.e. water cooled air compressors).
Incorrect viscosity for ambient operating temperature
